edu.ncsu.csc216.tracker.model

Class RequirementsList

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.tracker.model.RequirementsList

  • public class RequirementsList
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the RequirementList class and is created after a Requirement and state pattern are implemented. This class maintains a list of Requirements. It will be an ArrayList.
    Author:
    jhnguye4

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RequirementsList()
      Constructor for RequirementsList that instantiates and creates an empty ArrayList

        public RequirementsList()

    • Method Detail

      • addRequirement

        public int addRequirement(java.lang.String summary,
                          java.lang.String acceptanceTestId)
        This method creates a new Requirement and adds it to the RequirementList array
        Parameters:
        summary - is the summary that is set in the Requirement
        acceptanceTestId - is the String that is set in the Requirement for acceptanceTestId
        Returns:
        int of the RequirementId.

      • addXMLReqs

        public void addXMLReqs(java.util.List<edu.ncsu.csc216.tracker.xml.Req> list)
        This method takes a list of Reqs and creates them into Requirements by calling on the constructor in Requirement that takes in a Req. After a Requirement is made, it will be placed in the RequirementList
        Parameters:
        list - is the List of Reqs that will be converted to Requirements

      • getRequirements

        public java.util.ArrayList<Requirement> getRequirements()
        This class returns the ArrayList of Requirements
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Requirements

      • getRequirementById

        public Requirement getRequirementById(int reqId)
        This class returns a Requirement after it parses through the RequirementList to see if the reqId passed through matches a reqId in the RequirementList.
        Parameters:
        reqId - is the Requirement that the user is looking for
        Returns:
        the Requirement that matches the reqId, if no id matches then it will return null

      • executeCommand

        public void executeCommand(int reqId,
                           Command c)
        This method will update the Requirement that matches the id passed through. The command param will have the information that will allow the user to update.
        Parameters:
        reqId - is the id that you are looking for when parsing through the RequirementList
        c - is the Command object that will have the information to update the Requirement

      • deleteRequirementById

        public void deleteRequirementById(int reqId)
        This method will remove a Requirement if its id matches an id in the RequirementList
        Parameters:
        reqId - is the Requirement id that that the user is looking for
